thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 18 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: PRESS DIGEST- Canada-April 18

author: Reuters Editorial
title: PRESS DIGEST- Canada-April 18
text:
April 18 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
THE GLOBE AND MAIL ** British Columbia is vowing to seek an injunction if Alberta moves to curtail fuel shipments even as the province's attorney-general derides the threat as a political stunt. ( tgam.ca/2H8RLAa )
** Hong Kong billionaire Li Ka-shing and two Canadian investors have made Bombardier Inc's short list of buyers for the manufacturer's aerospace plant and surrounding lands in northwest Toronto, according to sources familiar with the matter. ( tgam.ca/2J6Le5k )
** Private equity firm Catalyst Capital Group Inc is pressing ahead with its effort to wring money out of its failed bid for Wind Mobile, and claims to have evidence against a rival fund manager that may have been gathered in a sting operation run by former Israeli spies. ( tgam.ca/2JUUB9v )
NATIONAL POST ** Netflix Inc's official Canadian subscriber numbers may be top secret, but new estimates suggest the online streaming service is booming in Canada with more than 6 million customers. ( bit.ly/2JThdau ) (Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)
